item.title: 震荡市场威胁欧洲央行"有利地位"，但利率仍维持不变
item.description: 欧洲央行周四几乎肯定会维持利率不变，并暗示近期不会采取政策行动，尽管欧元兑美元汇率近期大幅上涨，加剧了通胀可能低于目标的担忧。【原文：The European Central Bank is all but certain to keep interest rates unchanged on Thursday and signal that no policy move is imminent, even if the euro's recent surge against the dollar fuels concerns that inflation might undershoot its target.】

item.title: 伊利诺伊州男子承认入侵Snapchat账户窃取裸照
item.description: 一名伊利诺伊州男子周三承认，他通过钓鱼手段骗取近600名女性的Snapchat访问密码，以此入侵她们的账户窃取裸照，并将这些照片留存、出售或在网上交易。【原文：An Illinois man pleaded guilty on Wednesday to phishing the Snapchat access codes of nearly 600 women in order to hack their accounts and steal nude photos, which he kept, sold or traded on the internet.】

item.title: 交易员争相锁定油价，因伊朗地缘政治风险及委内瑞拉供应增加
item.description: 投资者争相锁定创纪录的油价，因市场担忧伊朗原油供应问题，且更多委内瑞拉原油正运往美国墨西哥湾沿岸地区。【原文：Investors rushed to lock in oil prices at record levels in January amid concerns around Iranian crude supplies and more Venezuelan barrels heading to the U.S. Gulf Coast.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构因风险管控改善而削减麦格理旗下分支机构的流动性附加费
item.description: 澳大利亚监管机构周四表示，在麦格理集团旗下银行部门取得进展、改善其风险控制薄弱环节后，已降低了对其流动性要求。【原文：Australia's regulator said on Thursday it has reduced liquidity requirements imposed on Macquarie Group's banking arm after the lender made progress addressing weaknesses in its risk controls.】

item.title: 威瑞森无线起诉T-Mobile，指控其虚假广告
item.description: 威瑞森无线周三起诉T-Mobile，指控其最大竞争对手通过虚假广告承诺消费者若更换手机运营商每年可节省逾1000美元，此举造成了无法弥补的损害。【原文：Verizon Wireless sued T-Mobile on Wednesday, accusing its largest rival of false advertising and causing irreparable harm by promising consumers more than $1,000 of annual savings if they switch cellphone carriers.】

item.title: 独家：英伟达向字节跳动出售AI芯片取决于特朗普政府设定的条件
item.description: 据知情人士透露，特朗普政府愿意允许中国字节跳动收购英伟达的H200芯片，但这家人工智能芯片制造商尚未同意其拟议的使用条件。【原文：The Trump administration is willing to allow China's ByteDance to buy Nvidia's H200 chips, but the AI chipmaker has not agreed to proposed conditions for their use, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 交易日 科技极限挑战
item.description: 周三美国股市普遍下跌，因市场担忧人工智能革命可能对众多行业的企业构成生存威胁，而油价则因有关美伊计划谈判可能破裂的报道大幅上涨。【原文：U.S. stocks mostly fell on Wednesday, slammed by worries that the artificial intelligence revolution could pose an existential threat to businesses across many sectors, while oil rose sharply on reports that planned U.S.-Iran talks may collapse.】

item.title: 保险公司大都会人寿季度利润因强劲投资回报而上升
item.description: 大都会人寿周三公布第四季度经调整利润上升，得益于其投资组合回报率的提升。【原文：MetLife reported a rise in fourth-quarter adjusted profit on Wednesday, as the insurer was helped by a stronger return on its investment portfolio.】

item.title: 美联储决定维持银行资本缓冲至2027年不变，同时考虑调整压力测试方案
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会周三宣布，在2026年压力测试周期内不会调整大型银行的资本水平。该央行正考虑对这项年度测试进行若干调整，旨在提高透明度。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve announced on Wednesday it would not adjust large bank capital levels during the 2026 stress testing cycle, as the central bank considers several changes to the annual exercise aimed at boosting transparency.】

item.title: 科派季度利润因企业支出坚挺而上升
item.description: 商业支付公司Corpay周三报告称，第四季度利润实现增长，这得益于企业支出保持强劲，推动其企业支付业务板块业绩提升。【原文：Business payments firm Corpay reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, as resilient business spending boosted its corporate payments segment.】

item.title: Snap季度营收低于预期，广告竞争加剧
item.description: Snap周三公布的季度营收低于华尔街预期，表明其在数字广告市场面临来自Meta旗下Facebook和Instagram等大型竞争对手的激烈角逐。【原文：Snap forecast first-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, signaling tough competition for digital advertising dollars from bigger rivals such as Meta-owned Facebook and Instagram.】

item.title: 安森美半导体预计季度营收将因人工智能芯片需求超出预期
item.description: 安森美半导体周三预测第四季度营收将超出华尔街预期，主要得益于其节能芯片设计在人工智能领域的应用需求——从数据中心到智能手机均有涉足。【原文：Arm Holdings , forecast fourth-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, driven by demand for its energy-efficient chip designs used in artificial intelligence applications from data centers to smartphones.】

item.title: 精灵美妆上调年度预测，平价产品推动需求增长
item.description: 精灵美妆周三公布的第三季度业绩超出华尔街预期，该公司上调了全年销售额和利润预测。尽管经济和关税不确定性加剧，但其平价化妆品需求依然强劲，盘后股价应声上涨约12%。【原文：Elf Beauty raised its annual sales and profit forecasts after beating Wall Street estimates for third-quarter results on Wednesday, as demand for its affordable cosmetics stayed strong despite rising economic and tariff uncertainty, sending shares up about 12% after the bell.】

item.title: 谷歌母公司Alphabet预测2026年资本支出将大幅增长
item.description: 谷歌母公司Alphabet周三表示，今年资本支出目标定为1750亿至1850亿美元，这是该公司为在人工智能竞赛中抢占先机而加深投资力度所采取的又一轮激进支出扩张。【原文：Alphabet said on Wednesday it was targeting capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion this year, in yet another aggressive ramp-up in spending from the Google parent as it deepens its investments to push ahead in the AI race.】

item.title: 高通股价下跌，内存芯片短缺冲击智能手机市场
item.description: 芯片供应商高通周三预测第二季度营收和利润将低于华尔街预期，预计全球内存供应短缺将冲击手机销量。【原文：Chip supplier Qualcomm forecast second-quarter revenue and profit below Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, expecting a global memory supply shortage to hit mobile phone sales.】

item.title: 韩国为外汇稳定而战，却因其对华尔街的痴迷而受挫
item.description: 韩国稳定本币的努力正面临国内重大阻碍——随着韩元汇率跌至17年低点，散户投资者对美股的空前热情正推高美元需求。【原文：South Korea's efforts to stabilise its currency face a major obstacle at home - the record appetite of its retail investors for U.S. stocks that is fuelling dollar demand as the won languishes at 17-year lows.】

item.title: 肯德基母公司在中国忠诚度计划会员数突破5.9亿
item.description: 肯德基中国母公司报告称，其数字会员计划呈现强劲增长态势，会员数量突破5.9亿——相当于全国人口的40%以上。【原文：KFC’s parent company in China reported aggressive growth in its digital loyalty programs, exceeding 590 million members – representing more than 40% of the country.】

item.title: 彭博社报道称，塔吉特新任首席执行官表示该零售商已失去消费者和员工的信任
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，塔吉特公司新任首席执行官迈克尔·菲德尔克表示，这家大型零售商已失去消费者和员工的信任，并承诺将重建这种联系。【原文：Target Corp's new chief executive officer, Michael Fiddelke, said the big-box retailer has lost trust with shoppers and employees and pledged to rebuild that connection, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 随着银价飙升，潘多拉将推出镀铂珠宝
item.description: 丹麦珠宝制造商潘多拉周三宣布，将推出其畅销手链的铂金镀层版本，以期缓解银价历史性飙升带来的成本压力。【原文：Danish jewellery maker Pandora will start selling platinum-plated versions of its best-selling bracelets, the company said on Wednesday, as it tries to limit the impact of a historic surge in silver prices that has driven up costs.】

item.title: 特朗普在NBC采访中表示，降息可能性"基本确定"
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周三表示，他认为美联储将下调基准利率，对此他"几乎没有"怀疑。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday there was "not much" doubt in his mind that benchmark U.S. interest rates will be lowered by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 美国参议员斯科特在美联储主席提名遭遇阻挠之际表示，鲍威尔并非罪犯
item.description: 共和党参议员蒂姆·斯科特周三表示，他不认为美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔去年夏天向国会作证时触犯了法律，并表示若检察官前来询问，他会如此作证。【原文：Republican Senator Tim Scott on Wednesday said he does not believe Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell broke the law when he testified to Congress last summer, and would say that to any prosecutor who came asking.】

item.title: Telegram创始人杜罗夫称西班牙社交媒体计划将安全功能武器化
item.description: Telegram创始人帕维尔·杜罗夫周三公开谴责西班牙首相佩德罗·桑切斯计划禁止16岁以下青少年使用社交媒体，并因平台上的仇恨言论起诉高管的行为，此举与埃隆·马斯克的立场一致。【原文：Telegram founder Pavel Durov on Wednesday joined Elon Musk in publicly criticising plans by Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez to ban social media access for under 16s and to prosecute executives for hate speech on their platforms.】

item.title: 美国核电监管机构计划调整政策以配合特朗普政府对核反应堆的目标
item.description: 美国核能监管机构周三表示，正根据特朗普总统加快核反应堆许可审批的目标进行重组。【原文：The U.S. nuclear power regulator said on Wednesday it is undergoing a reorganization in line with President Donald Trump's goals on speeding up licensing of nuclear reactors.】

item.title: 软件抛售重创股市，逢低买盘消失
item.description: 周三软件板块的抛售潮持续加剧，未能吸引抄底者入场，以往屡次拯救科技股暴跌的逢低买入反应此次却明显缺席。【原文：The software sector's deepening selloff on Wednesday failed to lure bargain hunters, with the dip-buying reflex that has rescued countless tech routs conspicuously absent.】

item.title: 牙科行业或于2026年趋稳，但完全复苏仍遥遥无期，分析师称
item.description: 华尔街期待牙科产品制造商能为2026年描绘更光明的前景，但分析师指出，整个行业的全面复苏可能仍需时日。【原文：Wall Street is hoping dental-product makers will offer a brighter 2026 outlook, but analysts say a full industry rebound may still be some time away.】

item.title: 耐克因涉嫌歧视白人员工面临美国调查
item.description: 美国负责执行反职场歧视法律的机构周三在法庭文件中表示，正就耐克公司涉嫌通过多元化政策歧视白人一事展开调查。【原文：The U.S. agency that enforces laws banning workplace discrimination said in a court filing on Wednesday it is investigating Nike for allegedly discriminating against white people through its diversity policies.】

item.title: 外部审计师将监督石油资金流向委内瑞拉，贝森特表示
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特·贝森特周三向国会议员表示，美国财政部将引入外部审计机构，监督石油资金流向委内瑞拉的情况。【原文：The U.S. Treasury will bring in outside auditors to monitor the flow of oil funds to Venezuela, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told lawmakers on Wednesday.】

item.title: 汽车制造商支持特朗普放宽燃油经济性标准的计划，但要求进行调整
item.description: 主要汽车制造商周三呼吁修改特朗普政府提出的燃油经济性标准改革方案，但表示支持大幅削减能效要求的计划。【原文：Major automakers on Wednesday called for changes in the Trump administration's proposal to reform fuel economy standards, but said they back the plan to drastically slash the efficiency requirements.】

item.title: 联合国儿童基金会呼吁将描绘儿童性虐待的人工智能内容定为刑事犯罪
item.description: 联合国儿童基金会周三呼吁各国将制作人工智能生成儿童性虐待内容的行为定为犯罪，称其对人工智能图像性化儿童数量增加的报道深感震惊。【原文：The United Nations children's agency UNICEF on Wednesday called for countries to criminalize the creation of AI-generated child sexual abuse content, saying it was alarmed by reports of an increase in the number of artificial intelligence images sexualizing children.】

item.title: First Brands创始人帕特里克·詹姆斯对欺诈指控表示不认罪
item.description: 汽车零部件供应商First Brands的创始人帕特里克·詹姆斯周三对指控表示不认罪，此前该公司破产倒闭前，他涉嫌欺诈贷款方数亿美元。【原文：Patrick James, the founder of auto parts supplier First Brands, pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges he defrauded lenders out of billions of dollars before the company collapsed into bankruptcy.】
